lines.text: We gotta go. We're dated with some jolly undertakers from Schenectady.
Yeh, they dance round on your feet half the night and then crave affection.
Well, ta, ta, dearie - we're entertaining some shy sheiks from Cheyenne.
I've got great news - - ! I have an invention that will open any safe in the world.
I know a gang of crooks that'll buy it.
No, David! Don't go crooked. It don't pay. If crooks can use it to get in safes - - can't bankers use it to keep them out?
Bankers will steal it. Crooks will be on the level with you.
In my day, girls didn't go to dances with strange young men alone.
You never married did you, Auntie?
Miss Banning, this is Molly.
Thought you might be going to Kelly's - - But I guess you ain't.
Say, what do you mean pulling that cheek-to-cheek stuff in public?
Well, we licked him.
Girls, I just met the thrillingest man!
I wonder if it's hard to be respectable?
I'll marry you if you want me to.
Don't be so reckless.
It's that Dave guy. Watch him give you the gate after he sells that invention
He won't! He won't!
Isn't it thrilling to be a successful inventor? Would you let a mere woman come and see your workshop?

[Florence kisses David on the dance floor]
It's my fault. I'm wicked - - wicked!
Molly's a great girl and I owe everything to her - - It was through her that I met you.
She loves you, David. I could see it in her face.
Why, Molly's been in love with 'Chunky' Dunn for years.
A woman knows, David.
Molly's a good little pal, but I never loved her.
I love you, David. Nothing can change that - - But Molly has a greater claim.
